lines.text: [Daffy is writing a license to shoot a fricasseeing rabbit to Elmer Fudd]
This license permits bearer to shoot a frica... Hey, bud, how do you spell "Fricasseeing".
F-R-I-C-A-S-S-E-E-I-N-G... eh, D-U-C-K!
[Daffy gives Elmer the license]
Here you are, Leatherstocking. All nice and legal.
[Elmer pauses to read the license]

[impatiently]
Hurry up, hurry up! The fine print doesn't mean a thing!
[Elmer looks confused]
Hurry up, Hurry up!
[Elmer shoots Daffy; his beak spins around]
Hey, let's see that thing!
[reading]
... fricasseeing duck. Well, I guess I'm the goat.
Goat Season Open!
[Elmer shoots the "goat"]
[Bugs' cup of molasses is shot into holes by Elmer]
Funny. I never thought molasses would run in January.
[Elmer has shot Daffy one too many times]

Shoot me again! I enjoy it! I love the smell of burnt feathers, and gunpowder, and cordite! I'm an elk! Shoot me, go on! It's elk season! I'm a fiddler crab! Why don't you shoot me? It's fiddler crab season!

[to Bugs as a game warden]
Oh, Mr. Game Warden. I hope you can help me. I've been told I could shoot wabbits and goats and pigeons and mongooses and dirty skunks and ducks. Could you tell me what season it weawwy is?
Why, coitenly, me boy. It's baseball season!

[after shooting a rabbit Bugs made out of snow]
Good heavens! He disintegwated.
[Bugs comes down as the "angel" of the snow rabbit]
Eh, what's up, doc? How are things down here on Earth?
I'm sowwy, Mr. Wabbit. I hope I didn't hurt you too much when I killed you.
Are you nuts? Why, if he's dead, then I'm a mongoose!
Mongoose Season.
[Elmer shoots the "mongoose"]
Just between the two of us, what season is it, really?
Ha, ha, ha! Don't be so naive, buster. Why, everybody knows it's really duck hunting season.
[Hunters suddenly materialize and shoot Daffy; he drags himself towards Bugs]

[panting]
You're despicable!
You're not gonna pay no more attention to no more signs! You're just gonna listen to me, right?
Wight.

[disguised as a duck]
Quack! Quack!
[moves his eyebrows up and down]
Oh, so that's his little game is it? Shoot the duck! Shoot the duck!
[shoots Daffy Duck]
[Bugs is disguised as a game warden]
Oh, Mr. Game Warden, I hope you can help me. I've been told I can shoot wabbits, and goats, and pigeons, and mongooses, and dirty skunks, and ducks. Can you tell me what season it weawy is?
Why certainly, my boy.
[Holds up a baseball]
It's baseball season!
[Elmer laughs dementedly]

[Throws the baseball]
Here, boy! Here, boy! Go get it! Go get it!
[Elmer runs after the baseball, shooting it repeatedly]

[to Elmer about Bugs]
What is this, a cooking class? Shoot him! Shoot him!
But I haven't got a wicense to shoot a fwicasseeing wabbit.
now, what are you?
I'm a hunter.
And what season is it?
Wabbit season.

[pointing to Bugs]
And there's a rabbit! Shoot him! Shoot him!
[Elmer hurries over to blast Bugs, but actually just blasts to smithereens a snowman dummy version of him]
Good heavens! He disintegwated.
Boy, am I a pigeon!
Pigeon Season.
You're a dirty dog...
And YOU are a dirty skunk!
I'm a dirty skunk? I'M a dirty skunk?
[Bugs holds up a sign saying "Dirty Skunk Season" - Elmer, predictably, lets him have it]
I am a duck bent on self-preservatimun-minum.
Got you, you wabbit stew, you.
Look, Doc. Are you looking for trouble? I'm not a stewing rabbit. I'm a fricasseeing rabbit.
Fwicasseeing wabbit?
Have you got a fricasseeing rabbit license?
Well, no. I...
Do you happen to know what the penalty is for shooting a fricasseeing rabbit without a fricasseeing rabbit license?
I'm a wed-hot sportsman after wild game. Heh-heh-heh-heh.
